newsitem.title: USA: American Home Q3 drug sales up six pct.
newsitem.headline: American Home Q3 drug sales up six pct.

text.p: American Home Products Corp said on Tuesday that its third quarter worldwide pharmaceutical sales rose six percent to $2.0 billion.
Its U.S. drug sales increased 13 percent in the quarter, driven by anti-obesity products Pondimin and Redux and Premarin hormone replacement therapies.
Some cardiovascular drugs had lower sales in the quarter, the company said, although it did not provide details.
International drug sales rose five percent in the quarter, American Home said.
Its worldwide drug sales rose 10 percent on a pro forma basis -- reflecting all businesss disposed of, discontinued or acquired in 1996 and 1995, the company said.
American Home reported third quarter earnings of $0.77 a share, up from $0.64 a year ago excluding a charge. The quarter's earnings were in line with Wall Street consensus.

American Home said its consumer health care sales were flat in the quarter on both a reported and pro forma basis at $564.7 million. The division's U.S. sales rose one percent, while its international sales were flat.
Medical device sales rose 12 percent on a reported basis to $321.1 million in the quarter but were off five percent on a pro forma basis, the company said.

Agricultural products rose four percent to $304.2 million on both pro forma and reported basis. U.S. agricultural product sales fell six percent while international agriculture sales gained nine percent.

Sales of food products rose 22 percent on both a pro forma and reported basis to $254.8 million in the quarter. Last month the company said it was selling 80 percent of the food unit to private investment firm Hicks, Muse, Tate & Furst Inc for $1.2 billion in cash.
